main event: On 31 May 1949, 1st Lt. James J. Giles reported observing an unidentified object while flying an F-80 aircraft over Honshu Island, Japan.
interesting points: The observer believed the object was reflecting sunlight, resembling the brightness of a B-29 aircraft., The object was estimated to be 20 to 30 miles away and above 30,000 feet., The sighting lasted about 10 minutes, during which the object flew in a northerly direction., Operational units confirmed that no other aircraft were in the area, ruling out conventional explanations for the sighting., The incident is thought to possibly have been the planet Venus due to its positioning in the sky at the time.
witness description: 1st Lt. James J. Giles, USAF Pilot
